channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Appliance left on the pavement, 14th January
item.description:
Kitchen appliance left on the pavement next to Butterfield Green.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big pothole at the corner turning on Annandale Road, 14th January
item.description:
Big pothole at the corner junction turning on Annandale Road (around number 100) and generally bad road surface along the length of the street. The main pothole is getting worse very quickly.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Annandale Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bricks sinking into pavement, 14th January
item.description:
Tripping hazzard created by bricks sinking into pavement

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rotherhithe Street, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blue van pulled onto the estate and put all building supplies, 14th January
item.description:
Blue van number plate LV72 YGU drove past me and put all building supplies (Breeze blocks and other building supplies on the floor and bricks into the bins
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Burrage Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous dunked pavement bricks, 14th January
item.description:
As above. These sunken bricks are a potential trip hazard. They have been sunken (and are sinking further) for several months now. This will also be the third time in the last four years that I have lived here, that there has been issues with these bricks. In each instance, the work completed to rectify the issue has clearly been inferior.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brookmead Way, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bags dumped blocking fire exit, 14th January
item.description:
Rubbish bags ( approx 8) have been fly tipped on Wenlock Street blocking my fire escape again. This happens about once a month and is dangerous, unhealthy and looks horrible.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shepherdess Walk, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lamp blocked by trees, 14th January
item.description:
The street lamp in the footpath joining Green Close to Shortlands Road is blocked by overgrowing trees from 27 Shortlands Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shortlands Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Middle of the road (on West End Lane, at the pinpointed location), 14th January
item.description:
Water coming up through road surface (looks like there is a burst pipe or similar) is leading to large quantities of water flowing along street and pooling in places.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 157, West End Lane, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inlet/outlet pipe blocked, 14th January
item.description:
The inlet/outlet pipe from main pond into small pond is blocked.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): River Park View, Goddington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Corner of Achilles Road and Ajax Road, 14th January
item.description:
Blocked drain / gulley. I tried reporting to Thames Water but it says that isn’t their responsibility and blocked gulleys are for the local council to maintain.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ajax Road, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several 2ft long and 2inch deep potholes end of Sheridan road, 14th January
item.description:
These bad potholes have been here for months, at the avenue road end of Sheridan road, just before Christmas the road was closed for two weeks for gas pipes to be laid, now it’s closed for water repairs, surely it would be common sense and practical to fill them in now, also stopping motorists claiming for damage to suspensions, etc.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sheridan Road, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The rubbish is horrendous, 14th January
item.description:
How can you let this area get so bad it shames the area
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A126, Chafford Hundred, South Ockendon
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on roof of number 2 - 4 Upper Wickham Lane, 14th January
item.description:
The roof has been tagged on both sides of the main pitch roof and the flat roof. It is clearly visible from the main road. Please can this be looked into again. We keep reporting and being told it has been referred to contractor and then being told it has been closed as it has been removed. IT HAS NOT BEEN REMOVED.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Upper Wickham Lane, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside school opposite garage on Sandall Road, 14th January
item.description:
There is a big hole where a tree was due to be planted and there is subsidence in the pavement causing the water gathered to turn to ice, our children have already had falls due to these hazards.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandall Road, Kentish Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deceased pet, 14th January
item.description:
Deceased pet in back garden
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Park Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poo on pavement, 14th January
item.description:
Poo on east side of pavement near end of road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Queen's Row, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large pothole just north of the southbound compulsory bus stop, 14th January
item.description:
This pothole is a recurring one. I believe there is a hole in the road foundation. The buses pull in for the bus stop, bounce into it and back it is again. It looks real nasty.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Elm Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large deep pot hole on bend at traffic lights, 14th January
item.description:
This pot hole has been here for months, and has got very much deeper and wider over the winter. Road is used by buses and lorry's which is causing more damage, nearly invisible with heavy rain filling it in. It is right at the lights on the bend, smaller vehicles are more likely to take significant damage.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tunnel Avenue, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ashdale Rd Junction with Winn Rd Wooden post used as bollard has been knocked over causing tarmac to rise up, 14th January
item.description:
The issue of cars turning into Ashdale rd too widely, often on the wrong side of the road needs to be addressed as it keeps happening. Traffic calming measures need to be put into place.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Winn Road, Horn Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extensive rubbish dumped, 14th January
item.description:
Fridges been there since September 2025 Bin storage areas blocked by rubbish Trees been there for weeks House/flat clearance has been dumped there today and back in September Rubbish spilling around the corner. Reported to LEMB numerous times

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Loughborough Junction, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
